posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: As a cure for worrying, work is better than whisky.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: I never did a day's work in my life.  It was all fun.

posts.author: Charles Dickens
posts.content: I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together.

posts.author: Charles Dickens
posts.content: We need never be ashamed of our tears.

posts.author: Charles Dickens
posts.content: Minds, like bodies, will often fall into a pimpled, ill-conditioned state from mere excess of comfort.

posts.author: Charles Dickens
posts.content: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.

posts.author: Charles Dickens
posts.content: Subdue your appetites, my dears, and you've conquered human nature.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: Faith, as well intentioned as it may be, must be built on facts, not fiction--faith in fiction is a damnable false hope.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: There is no expedient to which a man will not go to avoid the labor of thinking.

posts.author: Charles Dickens
posts.content: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.

posts.author: Charles Dickens
posts.content: Reflect on your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: The doctor of the future will give no medicine, but will interest her or his patients in the care of the human frame, in a proper diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: If we all did the things we are capable of doing, we would literally astound ourselves.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: To invent, you need a good imagination and a pile of junk.

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: I never did anything worth doing by accident, nor did any of my inventions come by accident

posts.author: Thomas Edison
posts.content: Hell, there are no rules here-- we're trying to accomplish something.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: Both formerly and now, it is only suffering that I describe, and the cessation of suffering.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: Should you find a wise critic to point out your faults, follow him as you would a guide to hidden treasure.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: 'As I am, so are these. As are these, so am I.' Drawing the parallel to yourself, neither kill nor get others to kill.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: It's a good thing to be satisfied with what one has.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: One is not called noble who harms living beings. By not harming living beings one is called noble.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: Should a person do good, let him do it again and again. Let him find pleasure therein, for blissful is the accumulation of good.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: We will develop and cultivate the liberation of mind by lovingkindness, make it our vehicle, make it our basis, stabilize it, exercise ourselves in it, and fully perfect it.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: To support mother and father, to cherish partner and children, and to be engaged in peaceful occupation — this is the greatest blessing.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: As a water bead on a lotus leaf, as water on a red lily, does not adhere, so the sage does not adhere to the seen, the heard, or the sensed.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: They blame those who remain silent, they blame those who speak much, they blame those who speak in moderation. There is none in the world who is not blamed.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: Better than a thousand useless words is one useful word, upon hearing which one attains peace.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: All tremble at violence; all fear death. Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: May all beings have happy minds.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: Ceasing to do evil, Cultivating the good, Purifying the heart: This is the teaching of the Buddhas.

posts.author: The Buddha
posts.content: When watching after yourself, you watch after others. When watching after others, you watch after yourself.

posts.author: Ayn Rand
posts.content: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.

posts.author: Thomas Jefferson
posts.content: I hope we shall crush in its birth the aristocracy of our monied corporations which dare already to challenge our government to a trial by strength, and bid defiance to the laws of our country.

posts.author: Shaquille O'Neal
posts.content: I'm tired of hearing about money, money, money, money, money. I just want to play the game, drink Pepsi, and wear Reebok.

posts.author: Benjamin Disraeli
posts.content: Never complain and never explain.

posts.author: Billie Jean King
posts.content: Champions keep playing until they get it right.

posts.author: Carl Lewis
posts.content: Life is about timing.

posts.author: Edward Gibbon
posts.content: Our work is the presentation of our capabilities.
